videoDetails.Title: Desmos Plays "Never Gonna Give You Up" using 1,500,000 Curves
videoDetails.Description:
~2000 Bézier Curves per Frame, at 25 Frames each second, multiplied by 30 seconds makes ~1,500,000 Bézier Curves. Each frame was plotted programmatically on the Desmos graphing calculator using custom software: https://github.com/BenMullan/GraphPictures

If you are want to see a bit more about how this sort of thing can be done, do take a look at some of the experimental Graphs I produced along the way:
- Animated Hexagon: https://www.desmos.com/calculator/efj4ndrlvt
- Swan: https://www.desmos.com/calculator/6acoyqsq7j
- Coloured Windows Logo: https://www.desmos.com/calculator/vc7dub2kdj
- "See?": https://www.desmos.com/calculator/x5cu6ntcoy
- Animated Shield: https://www.desmos.com/calculator/pb6ycqbwp8
- Draggable Bézier: https://www.desmos.com/calculator/bvsz7lqnr0
- Example Rick-Frame: https://www.desmos.com/calculator/wmrcevcnnz

Thanks for watching!
